cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 555 mi E of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest today, then west to west-southwest Tuesday–Thursday, approaching the northwestern Bahamas Wednesday and moving toward the southeast–central Florida Atlantic coast Wednesday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (roughly West Palm Beach–Port St. Lucie corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for the northwestern Bahamas (Andros, New Providence, Eleuthera, Abacos, Berry Islands, Grand Bahama, Bimini)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas and much of the southeast Florida coast northward through the southeastern United States coastline later this week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – 2–4 in. common with locally higher totals possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible – surge guidance not yet issued for FL but similar magnitudes (3–5 ft) forecast for Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) likely by late Wednesday; a few hurricane-force gusts possible if Nicole strengthens before landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels and coastal flooding of roughly 2–4 ft possible along the southeast FL barrier islands, especially during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy squalls with 2–4 inches, isolated 6 inches, expected Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands impacting port operations
